sub_title: Branding Strategist, Community Manager, Marketing Manager, Content Creator, Event Organizer, Business Development Manager with 10 - year China experience and a Charismatic Educator with 15 years of experiencee
summary:
•  Branding strategist, Content Creator, Author of 2 e - books based on my business and lifestyle 
    experience in China
•  Founder of Pierogi, Cocktails & Jars - Amsterdam Edition
•  Founder, Creative Director and General Manager of Jar Bar Shanghai
•  Co-founder and PR for Pierogi Ladies - the only Polish food brand in Shanghai
•  PR and Community Manager at Culture Shock Bike Tours
•  Charismatic Educator with 14 years of experience
•  Founder of the popular blog ‘Shanghai City Girl’ about Chinese language and Chinese culture ( With a popular series of episodes 'Found in translation' which explains Chinese slang and peculiarities of Chinese culture) , health and economical lifestyle in Shanghai.
• Co-editor of the blog Shanghai Hunter 
• Author of a noteworthy Master’s thesis titled:
‘Personal and situational conditioning of foreign language learning – has everybody got equal chances to succeed in foreign language learning and are we able to predict it?
• Former Cultural Ambassador in China who gained deep  insight  into Chinese culture by living with two completely different Chinese families: in Chengdu and Shanghai.
• World traveler with   18 visited countries on 3 continents so far   and work experience on all 3 of them including Alaska as one of top highlights.
It equipped me with the ability to easily adapt to working in multinational environment and efficiently co- work   with   people of various cultures

As a result of the school’s experimental character, I was assigned to teach not only ESL but also English,  Public Speaking and Drama , although my original role was to be an ESL and Psychology teacher. Thanks to my creativity and flexibility, I succeeded in this role – I helped students get out of their comfort zones during drama classes and helped them significantly improve their public speaking skills throughout various games and  challenging as well as fun activities .

2.	I quickly managed to develop great rapport with my new students and gained their respect thanks to my Mandarin skills and showing them I am constantly learning, and that during our classes we can learn from each other. I enriched my ESL classes with various activities and interesting videos as well as drama elements to motivate students and make lessons more appealing.', 'title': 'ESL/English /Public speaking teacher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Si  Hui  Training Center', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Shanghai City, China', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'Si  Hui  Training Center', 'description': '1.	Due to Si Hui’s profile, I I have had the chance to work in numerous schools and kindergartens in Shanghahi, very frequently with classes consisting of about 30 students.Through this invaluable experience I significantly developed the skill of class control which allows me now to easily manage  discipline and still  gain students’  favors with my cheerful  attitude  right from the word go.
2.	 Additionally, it has been very common situation that I have had to cover other teachers at  short notice and it taught me flexibility in adapting to various classroom conditions, even including being able to give high quality class in the situation of  finding out its topic 10 minutes before start.
3.	It is also worth mentioning that while working for one of Si Hui’s contracted schools, I hosted in English and Chinese its annual New Year’s concert ,which took place in Shanghai’s Concert Hall.What is more, I also took part in one of the performances as the only foreign teacher among other Chinese teachers.After the show I received a lot of congratulations from students’ parents, who appreciated my efforts, which  showed them how heavily involved I was in the school’s projects.', 'title': 'Primary School Teacher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1152745, 'name': 'HHS International Cultural Exchange Center', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHuMokd0u-kBw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519896568992?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=rHGv0hElzQp666ACMny08-DPu0msiGuObAjASMAuRAg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/hhs-international-cultural-exchange-center/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Chengdu, Sichuan, China, Shanghai', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'company': 'HHS International Cultural Exchange Center', 'description': '1.	During this unique time period I was introducing Western culture and traditions as well as teaching English to Chinese families while living with them,first with one family in Chengdu and then with another one in Shanghai.
2.	That one of a kind experience was an amazing life lesson and provided me with essential knowledge about interacting with Chinese people, their traditions and way of thinking.
3.	I can also proudly say that I had a great impact on both families’ kids, being role model about sharing and caring about others.I consider it one of my greatest accomplishments that my Shanghai based Chinese host family still considers me their family member since they believe I brought a lot of happiness into their home.', 'title': 'Cultural Ambassador', 'employment_type': None}]}]
